text: Mulberry Fields is a historic home located at Beauvue, St. Mary's County, Maryland, United States. It was built about 1763, and is a large -story, 5-bay by 2-bay, hip-roofed brick house. On the front is a two-story Doric portico, built about 1820. The house is the only remaining Georgian "mansion-type" home in an area and has a panoramic view of the Potomac River, with a mile-long allee stretching downhill to the riverbank. Mulberry Fields was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1973. ==References== ==External links== *, including undated photo, at Maryland Historical Trust * Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Maryland Category:Houses in St. Mary's County, Maryland Category:Houses completed in 1763 Category:Georgian architecture in Maryland Category:Historic American Buildings Survey in Maryland Category:National Register of Historic Places in St. Mary's County, Maryland
title: Mulberry Fields
